channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Limits of the AI-Generated 'Eyes on Rafah' Image
item.description: The “All Eyes on Rafah” image went viral on social media this week, with over 47 million shares on Instagram alone. It's bringing up tough questions a...

item.title: Spain bans Meta from launching election features on Facebook, Instagram over privacy fears
item.description: Meta has been banned from launching features on Facebook and Instagram that would have collected data on voters in Spain using the social networks ahe...

item.title: Apple iPad Air (M2, 2024) Review: Bigger and Slightly Brighter
item.description: Apple's lightweight tablet comes equipped with a faster processor, but it's the bigger screen that steals the spotlight.

item.title: Stripe curbs India ambitions over regulatory changes

item.title: Google Admits Its AI Overviews Search Feature Screwed Up

item.title: Voice cloning of political figures is still easy as pie
item.description: The 2024 election is likely to be the first in which faked audio and video of candidates is a serious factor. As campaigns warm up, voters should be a...

item.title: Trump’s Online MAGA Army Calls Guilty Verdict a Declaration of War

item.title: OneScreen.ai brings startup ads to billboards and NYC’s subway
item.description: When Alex Ewing was a kid growing up in Purcell, Oklahoma, he knew how close he was to home based on which billboards he could see out the car window....

item.title: Foreign Influence Campaigns Don’t Know How to Use AI Yet Either
item.description: OpenAI has released its first report, which details how bad actors in Russia, China, and beyond are using AI to spread propaganda. (Poorly.)

item.title: SpaceX sent Starship to orbit — the next launch will try to bring it back
